revised_title: Exploring the Microstructure of Normal and Adventitious Bone
tldr: Alfred Smee examined thin sections of bone under a microscope and discovered small, irregularly-shaped corpuscles arranged in circular layers around Haversian canals. These corpuscles are connected by filaments and are hollow with cavities that sometimes communicate with the canals. The dimensions of these corpuscles are extremely small, ranging from the 10,000th to the 4,000th part of an inch in diameter and the 2,300th to the 1,400th part in length.
